36136556.review:
JYDGE невозможно ни описать, ни играть не опираясь на Neon Chrome: если вы в NC не играли, то JYDGE на мой взгляд даже рассматривать не стоит, по многим параметрам это не самостоятельное произведение.

Фактически JYDGE - standalone-DLC, аддон для тех, кто в Neon Chrome хотел не только крошить всё в пыль, но и выполнять более осмысленные задания. Вся игра это набор заданий и челленджей, пытающися утилизировать все имеющиеся в игре механики, чась из которых была поправлена и улучшена. Челленджи можно выполнять по одному за заход (все сразу - необязательно), и в целом рассчет сделан на многократное перепрохождление уровней на 4х доступных усложностях для каждого уровня. Если вам челленджи вообще не интересны - игру покупать не надо, кроме них внутри ничего нет.

Удивительно, но густой judge-feel Neon Chrome разработчики умудрились загубить. Во-первых, самый странный набор музыки который мне доводилось встречать. Почему было снова не обратиться к synthwave? Сборная солянка из всего что не подходит по стилю вызывает ровно 1 желание - выключить музыку совсем или поставить OST к Neon Chrome. Во-вторых, сюжет. Его и в NC было немного, но он был отлично подан. Тут его можно просто было в текстовый файл в папку с игрой засунуть - настолько невыразительно и кратко сделаны сюжетные вкрапления. Все вышеупомянутое порождает нехорошие размышления о количестве прилагаемых для разработки усилий.

С другой стороны игровые механики улучшились, в частности допилен стелс, разнообразилась рукопашная, приоберли смысл и значение дополнительные типы оружия. Вообще в ходе игры, во многом благодаря челленджам, используешь практически все доступные перки и навыки. Это хорошо, потому что в Neon Chrome было 2 (ну допустим 3) наиболее удачные компоновки и эксперименты очень сильно били по выживаемости, а тут можно даже по-разному подойти к выполнению одной и той же задачи.

Итого: брать только фанатам Neon Chrome, которые признают челленджи за интересную игровую механику.
«Остальные смело идут в кабак»©

36120853.review:
Игра весьма достойна. В двух словах – 25 часов игры, пройдена на трех уровнях сложности, пройду и на четвертом. По сравнению с одним из лучших top-down шутеров Hotline Miami игра выглядит очень простой. Очень простой она и является, но от этого не теряет интереса. Ваш покорный слуга откатал игру, как указано выше без единого апгрейда пушки или альтернативного огня, на двух стволах – шотган для всех миссий и снайперка для медалей с невидимостью.
Плюсы игры очевидны – лютый драйв и колоритная музыка. Царский кооп – количество свинца на карте превышает мощности Nintendo switch. Весьма разнообразные карты, при видимом единообразии игровых элементов. Отличные испытания для медалей.
Купить эту игру за 700р+6 бутылок пива+друг= отлично проведенный вечер за мизерные деньги.
Минусы – за**ывает полностью переодеваться для каждой медали и перезагружать миссии. Медаль за неповреждение объектов – тоже минус. Не очень понятные хинты для коллекционных предметов. Но все эти минусы реально ерунда, по сравнению с угаром игры.
Резолюция – игра стоит своих денег, геймплей позволяет поиграть легко и приятно пару-тройку медалей, если есть 10-15 минут свободно.
10 рестартов миссии из 10.

35943122.review:
The only thing Jydge is missing to be an absolute 10/10 is a few more missions and maybe a scenario editor so people can set up their own.

It's a top-down shooter which supports everything from gung-ho Touhou-esque bullet-dodging through stealthy assassinations and sometimes even completely non-lethal approaches.

You essentially play a shameless Judge Dredd/Robocop crossover in a crime-ridden, neon-lit metropolis where you gun down bad guys, save innocents, collect evidence and cause ridiculous amounts of property damage in the process. The music's great, the art is simple but expressive and the controls are good. About the only issues I could pin on the game is that some of the weapon options are considerably less viable than others(and a few are so OP they were basically all I used throughout the game) and that it could maybe use a bit more content from the devs.

The addition of optional objectives that are sometimes bone-hard to pull off help provide the game with some longevity if you're the sort of person who likes to challenge themselves by getting all of the optionals. But some of them are an exercise in frustration since they A) require a very quiet and methodical approach to a mission, for up to five minutes, and then B) can be failed at the very last second of those five minutes because one guy saw you out of the corner of his eye or you got grazed by one bullet.

So even though I'm pretty completeist, I have to admit I did NOT get all the optionals, on any of the game's four difficulties.

All in all, pretty good game, with the only extensive source of frustration being that getting the soundtrack requires either dealing with a very broken site or getting Neon Chrome and using its modding tools to rip open Jydge's files to extract the music.

35912142.review:
本年度我玩了超过10小时的两款TPS游戏就是JYDGE和暴走机甲了。这两款游戏各有特色，但是却都是精品独立游戏。真的值得一玩！推荐使用手柄进行游玩，因为手柄带了一个自动瞄准的功能。

JYDEG可以说是一款成熟的第三人称俯视角射击游戏，但是这款游戏的精髓却是策略，无脑的突突突并不适合这款游戏。这款游戏在每一关都需要合理的配置，否则你会被小兵虐的很惨。比如第三关，无脑突进你就会陷入到小兵的包围圈中，但是携带隐身技能+电击技能就可以悄无声息的靠近然后击敌救人，效率要高出很多，成功率也高。

强大的技能系统也是本作的一大特色，虽然技能总数不多但是贵在每个技能都恰到好处，不重复也不多余。这款游戏的精髓也就在这里，它不是单纯的射击游戏，它更像是一款私人定制的游戏。在这里每个人都可以根据自己的习惯选择适合自己的组合，然后去大杀四方也可能是悄然潜入。你认为游戏怎么玩合适那就怎么玩。你可能屠光所有的小兵然后通关，当然也可以不杀一人救走人质。

枪械系统的可玩空间也很大，你可以根据自己需要改装你的法槌（枪的名字叫法槌之枪），让它可以携带火箭筒，或者等离子武器。还可以进行升级强化。本作中可携带的特殊武器种类很多，需要通过获得的勋章解锁。这也很大提升了游戏的可玩性。枪械系统的另外一个特点就是最大限度地还原了真实场景下的武器威力。比如我使用最多的还是火箭筒，因为它看着特效漂亮还可以开路（碰到不想要绕道的地方直接一炮过去保证什么障碍都扫平）。但是如果一个不小心火箭筒炸在你身边，你也得跟着gg。

说到这里，就必须提到金钱系统了。在本作中击杀敌人会掉落金币，地图搜集会掉落金币，完成特殊任务也会掉落金币，所以前期玩下来金币不会缺少。但是中后期随着武器升级、技能强化能花费的成倍提升，刷钱就成为了不可避免的事情。如果你想要一路通关的话，那这里可能会让你感到厌烦。

另外本作的随处可破坏的地图场景也是一大亮点，你可以看着路边的座椅不爽可以一梭子上去，然后它就不再碍你的眼了，看着是不是有种GTA的爽快感。

但是缺点就是本作流程偏短，目前还只有四个章节22个关卡。感觉还没玩够就结束了。

下面提交一些反馈：
1，桌面快捷方式的问题。游戏安装完成后桌面的图标显示的是一个“🌍”像这种的地球的图标，是默认的快捷方式的样式。
2，游戏人物的血条设计。在角色脚下的血条设计很有新意，但是至少要提示一下玩家血条在哪里，否则游戏中会很慌张。
3，地图左上角的格里奇岛一直在闪，应该是一个bug。

35762639.review:
It's a modern version of "Chip's Challenge" with blood, guts and guns... Well, about 10% of it anyways. 

Okay, so most parts of the game you can play just like your average isomatic(or top-down) action shooter, and its pretty darn great with it: There are no bad combination on 90% of the various upgrades you choose, and most mission's central goals can be completed with multiple tactics and any skill levels.

It's just SOME few handful of the medals, they might require particular sets of equipment combos and particular routes to earn them... That really isn't a problem for me, nor do I think its in any way unreasonable. (Except Gembine... But that's because I am pretty bad at ACTUAL puzzle games, and *something* is about getting a high score on that; My best score on that is about 11k or so, way way too low for that requirement.) Plus once you figuring out the particular trick to that medal there's that sense of "why didn't I see that sooner?" plus a little bit of a sense of accomplishment.

Pretty darn good in all aspects. Highly replayable. Freaking hard in places but not absolutely impossible. (Speaking from someone not all that good with reflex-based games, and REALLY bad at Neon Chrome their previous game.) Can be taken in bite size or day-long. It's probably one of the best of its type on Steam ATM.

35728584.review:
Build your JYDGE. Enter Edenbyrg. Get out alive. Build your own cybernetic JYDGE in this lawful-but-awful roguehate top-down shooter where you get to eradicate crime in the never-sleeping megacity of Edenbyrg.

Putting Y everywhere gets annoying quite soon, but well. Anyway, this game should be called Neon Chrome: Judge Dredd Edition, but it's called JYDGE instead. Oh well, at least you know what were they going for. Jydge is basically Neon Chrome, but instead of randomly generated levels you have fixed maps - with four difficulties - with three objectives per map. Objectivaes vary from simple and obvious, like rescue all hostages or kill all enemies, to tricky like complete the level in 15secs or kill the boss without being detected. This time you can upgrade your character by using cybernetics - 4 slots, you gain more as you pregress through the levels - and your weapons using different fire modes - lead, laser, ion -
 and mods - faster reload, explosive melee. If you liked Neon Chrome this one is no brainer.

I liked:
* solid mechanics
* lots of upgrades for your character and weapon
* you are the law

I disliked:
* ys ys yvyrywhyry

Get this if:
* you liked Neon Chrome
* you like twin stick shooters and are ok with the short missions formula

Don't get this if:
* you expect a story, apart from "I am the law!" there isn't any

35682960.review:
I almost didn't buy this game. I was in the mood for a good twin stick shooter and bought Neon Chrome. This was simply an impulse buy based off the discount you got for buying NC. I'm SUPER glad I did.

I don't usually devote too much time to little indie titles like this one because they tend to get old quick, but Jydge left me pleasantly surprised. Although it's not a huge game 10tons has packed a lot into this one. The wide variety of weapons and items lets you experience each level in a new way over and over again. At first it's pretty basic, but as you ramp up the difficulty and unlock new items your playstyle can ((and will definitely need to)) change through each incarnation of each level.

Some of the challenges are crazy difficult and at times I found myself thinking 'That will just never be possible.' ((I'm talking to you 'Thinning the Herd' on Nightmare)) After a few dozen tries and a few choice words I always managed to find a set of items and strategy that eventually worked out. This game is loads of fun and I never for an instant regretted my purchase.

I've seen a lot of people upset over levels being locked behind a prohibitive amount of medals and while I get the arguement I didn't have a problem with it. If anything it pushed me to explore new strategies and helped me to get more out of the game overall. The devs have since patched in an option for that though and I think such a quick response speaks pretty highly of them

There are a few small gripes:

1. The stealth mechanic can be a little wonky at times.

2. Some of the items and weapons in the game have little or no use, ((could just be personal taste though))

3. Civillian deaths rack up even when you don't finish the mission ((ie. die or quit)) and that sucks pretty hard when there is an acheivement and something else I thought was pretty cool attached to a low civie death count. There is a way to decrease it, but it can be time consuming or simply not an option I'm willing to choose.

4. Really feels as though there should be a tracker for loot chests and elite enemies and you for sure should be able to choose whether or not you want elites or locked doors to respwan.



My biggest gripe however is that it left me wanting more. I did everything there is to do and I'm just super sad it's over. I can't wait to see what they do with that gigantic world map!

It's a fast paced good time and well worth my money. Yours too.

8/10 Would buy more vowels.

35598472.review:
Let me preface this review to say I have not played Neon Chrome, nor do I agree 100% with what a lot of the negative reviews seem to have a gripe for with this game and its style of progression. I have just finished the last level of the game to give you an idea of where I am at.

First off the setting is fantastic. You are basically a robotic version of  Judge Dredd, placed in different scenarios ranging from rescue the VIPs to murder the crap out of all of the bad guys. The game feels best with a PS4 style controller I've found (well any controller with 2 sticks at least) as you will be using one to aim and one to move. The controls feel very fluid and fun.

Now each map has three different objectives and up to three difficulties (you unlock the two remaining difficulties over the course of the game). Completing an objective gives you a medal. These medals are basically your form of progression as they unlock new levels, new skills, new weapons, everything (then you use money to buy those unlocked items). If you stick to your play style you should have no problem making it through to at least the first half of the game. This is when you probably need to take a look back at the medals and see where you need to get them. A lot of people seem to be complaining about the ones where you exit in __ seconds. I feel like this is specifically a design choice not to make you a speed runner or care about time as much as its making sure you have put the money toward making sure your character has the power to deal with running through the earlier levels rather than making it to the next level and thinking its ridiculously hard when in reality its because you've invested poorly. I completed most of those for the first chapter just to make sure I could and did a few stealth missions from those as well. Aside from that I did not do any more of either of those style medals for the rest of the game, I just didnt need to, there were enough medals to unlock the remaining levels.

The game is definitely not easy but I love that it has some difficulty. But here are a few tips for while you go through the game:
- In the first half of the game do NOT just go and buy every weapon that unlocks. Stick to something you like and upgrade its damage as much as you can. For instance I went with the laser as my primary. That beast can rip through multiple enemies with a single hit and if you have the Vampire trait on your gun you get +10 health for every enemy you kill with it making crowds easier to deal with since they become a roving health kit (just dodge their bullets of course! not that it matters as much as you will be healing quick).
- Don't forget about your specials! They can do some ridiculous damage on enemies especially elite enemies. Not only that but can help with the environment. Dont have a key or hacking ability to open this door? BLOW IT OPEN! 
- Use the environment to your advantage. Don't run through that hallway full of enemies, go into the bathroom next to it, knock a hole in the wall behind one of the enemies and let them trickle through as you rain death upon them funnelling themselves into the room.
- Keep running into a problem with a type of enemy? There are probably multiple ways to resolve that. You'll run into melee enemies that just run up and bash the crap out of you and many are pretty powerful. You could buy the Bull Bullet perk, which hits them back for every hit of your projectile, OR you could max the crap out of your weapon and kill them early. Do what makes the most fiscal sense for you now, later in the game you will have more than enough money to unlock whatever you want.

Closing thoughts: I loved this game. It scratched the itch that the Crusader games left decades ago and has been festering. The only negative I have is wishing the game was a bit longer. HOWEVER thats not to say I didnt think the game was worth $15 for a game that took nearly 8 hours to complete (not 100% of the medals and unlocks of course). This does make me want to buy Neon Chrome however!


UPDATE: So after finishing this review I went right over and bought Neon Chrome. I honestly think Jydge made much of the gameplay and aspects of Neon Chrome easier than if I had just started with that as there is a lot of cross over with some enemies, objects and abilities. In the end I defeated Overseer 1.0 in 5 hours and on my 4th asset.

35563002.review:
When I saw that the creators of Neon Chrome made this, I was really excited and picked it up, but after playing it a bit, I became very dejected and disappointed.  My issue with the game is that progression is tied in with earning "medals" for completing specific objectives per level, and the medal curve becomes so steep to progress it becomes tedious to keep playing trying to get every little thing done the way the game wants it done.

What I really LOVED about Neon Chrome is the freedom and flexibility to complete levels the way you wanted to, such as clearing the whole floor or running right to the elevator to avoid death, and the way random chance created a new experience every time.  Jydge is the opposite experience, where each level plays out the same way, and you're forced to learn it and replay it as many times as it takes you to get enough medals to progress with either gear or the story itself.  

Although I really enjoyed the setting and aesthetic of the game, I find the way progression functions to make the game a tedious experience.

35549983.review:
This review is based on 2 hours of gameplay. Code was provided by the developers free of charge.

Jydge is a cyberpunk, objective-based twin-stick shooter that takes inspiration aesthetically and thematically from Robocop and Judge Dredd with some Hotline Miami and Neon Chrome thrown in for the gameplay. It does a ton of unique and fun things with itself and it's not afraid to crank up the challenge but the biggest flaws come into it's replay system.

Gameplay:
In each mission of Jydge you have a primary objective and two secondary objectives to complete. Once you complete an objective you gain a medal. Medals are used to unlock new missions & upgrades. The upgrades give a strong customization sense to the game as you will need to upgrade your weapons, armor and even upgrades in order to beat tougher missions and blitz through older missions to obtain all the medals. You can upgrade and busy new upgrades that you have unlocked through money which is obtained from opening item boxes in a level, collecting dropped cash from enemies and – you guessed it – getting medals.. This means that you will be redoing a lot of levels in the game.  Aside from that, the gameplay itself is pretty solid. There's a good variety of weapons and equipment to interact with the environment and all the enemy types which include mini-bosses. There's destruct-able environments, hack-able areas, small holes to sneak through and dark spots to hide in, all depending on the equipment you are using. AI is also solid. Enemies might not be hyper smart but they aren't ready to die. They will react loosely based on sight and sound and they aren't eager to run single file at times into your gunfire, sometimes hesitating.


Sound & Visuals:
The sounds are awesome. Weapon effects are pretty solid but the strongest point of this game audibly is its soundtrack. You get this orchestral, epic, robo-cop esque music in the title screen and on the map but in game you get this cyberpunk soundtrack that varies from sounding like rap to a rave to a combination of both and an orchestral feel. It's pretty dope. The weakest part of the game are the graphics. They don't really grab you or pop out. Thankfully, the game does run extremely well and makes up for it even further with a lot of environmental detail and colors to make everything stand out a bit more. The game looks dirty but in a good, appropriate way to match the tone of the gameplay.


Content:
Once you complete the first act you unlock hardcore mode which unlocks a new set of 3 medals to acquire for previous mentions you have beaten. Thankfully, hardcore mode switches up the secondary objectives as well as the enemy types and placement of objectives. The biggest issue with Jydge is that some medals are nearly impossible to acquire all at once and completely impossible to acquire on your first try for some missions. It's not very frustrating to get two levels on one mission but to get all 3 is where the frustration sets in, meaning you will need to play the level again just to get one medal and that's not counting doing that level for a 3rd/4th time respectively on hardcore mode. So even though there is a lot of content on the surface the game has you repeat it a lot. To the point of grinding for cash. I'd say the game is 4-5 hours long if you don't count replaying a mission more than once but you do count hardcore mode. So at the very least you do get 6+ hours if you like replaying levels and it can be fun to blast through older levels with decked-out gear. The unlocks keep you going to try new things and the game does have a diverse set of levels to go with it. There are even secret levels.


Overall, this is worth checking out if you enjoy twin-stick shooters or have been looking for a good one in a sea of mediocre ones. It's biggest issue is the replay system, as it's not used as a way to increase time at the players will. Instead it's mandatory and by the time you're done you don't have a desire to play it all again. However, if you can get past that it's a lot of fun and the aesthetics will keep you going through those tough times.

Time to JYDGE!

+ Awesome music, absolutelty awesome. Perfect stuff for a hectic topdownshooter! A lot of songs also!
+ Gameplay is very smooth, and close to perfection. Easy to learn, hard to master, just like it should be!
+ Awesome looking maps! Overall I enjoy the graphics very much and lights and shadows look so cool. I also love the cyberpunk feeling this game has, neon colours, and brutal killing.
+ I love the sleek humour this game has. I've laughed my ass off so many times reading the descriptions for perks etc.
+ I like how the normal-hard-grim modes have been made. You really need to think about your strategies how to encounter your enemies. It's a totally different gaming experience to hack enemies to pieces with melee, or to shoot them with shotguns, snipers etc. Or to be a total ninja and hide in shadows and complete the mission with no-one seeing you at all.
+ I find that this game has a lot of replayability. You can always grind more money and try to complete everything again and in a different approach.

I have nothing negative to say about the game. To anyone who likes classic topdown shooters, this is absolutely a must buy, just like neon chrome.

The game is a high angle isometric twin stick shooter. Armed with a GAVEL, the JYDGE progresses throygh levels to earn yp to six badges for completing a variety of objectives, from killing enemies to collecting things to rescying VIPs. These badges ynlock cybernetic ypgrades and new weapon modes for yoyr GAVEL, which can be pyrchased and ypgraded with the money yoy liberate from criminal elements. The gameplay is simple twin stick shooting, byt it is execyted marveloysly. 
    Movement and aim are reponsive, the weapons are distinct, and enemy byllets are highly visible 
and jyst slow enough to dodge. 
    The two greatest strengths of the game are the different mission objectives which allows for 
different playstyles and ypgrades, and the forgiving cooperative mode. Another player can grab a 
gamepad and effortlessly drop into the start of a mission. Friendly fire is off (except for 
explosions) and one player can continye even if their partner falls. This system generally makes 
coop very player friendly, even if there is disparity between player skill, althoygh a few 
mission objectives can become trickier, such as stealth or a flawless mission reqyirement. 
    My greatest complaint would be the pacing of progression. Missions and ypgrades reqyire a 
demanding nymber of badges, and the highest tiers of ypgrades become very expenisve.
    The game has clear visuals that are only sometimes obscyred if coop partners stray too far from one another and the camera myst pyll far oyt to keep them in frame. The low sci-fi environments (which are highly destryctible) tend to be gritty affairs with frequent contrasts between bright lights and dark areas, honestly reminding me a little of Blade Runner. Mysic and soynd effects are certainly adeqyate, but didn't particylarly stand oyt to me.
    With short, action packed missions and a variety of objectives and ways to solve them, JYDGE is not a difficylt recommendation if yoyr looking for a little supercop action fantasy, especially if yoy have a friend that can join yoy in local coop.

35507952.review:
The introduction to the game was a bit of a cold shower. Nothing prepares you to the small size of the maps. But this is because it isn't a straight-up shooter: in a sort of derivative, twisted [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/248610/Door_Kickers/]Door Kickers[/url], you are to be the law and the order, and do some serious judicial work by killing the right targets.
When, after a couple of maps, the structure of the game starts to make sense, it becomes a joy to play. Maps grow larger and larger, and soon enough, the chaos' nuances cover all of the Neon Chromic palette. There are persistent aspects to the way you shape the maps (I won't say more), which makes little sense narratively, but entice you to try and progress one step at a time when you are a bit low on the power curve.
The recycling of visual assets since Neon Chrome is obvious. Well, I don't really care. The gun mechanics are so good: if 10tons is to be to shooters what [url=http://store.steampowered.com/search/?developer=BrainGoodGames]BrainGoodGames[/url] has become for streamlined tactical puzzles, that is very fine with me!

35507144.review:
[url=http://gonewiththewin.com/review-jydge/]Click Here for Full Review[/url]
It's a top-down shooter, with a little more pizazz than most.

It's not just run and gun and pick up the glowing items on the ground, there's planning involved with 'execyting jydgment'. Dozens of items to power your character and dozens more that alter your weapon, in order to complete each mission and earn three medals.

These medals in turn, unlock more items and weapon enhancements as well as missions. To break up the monotony a 'hardcore' mode unlocks with three new mission objectives to earn. Is JYDGE genre defining? No. it's not. But it's clever mix of item selection, and objective based replays, while not new -- entertains.

There's a nice balance in this top down, at a nice low budget offering that should pique the interest of any top down or twin stick fan.

[b]PROS[/b]
- There are no letter 'U's in the future. I hate that letter. Every U is replaced with Y. yay!
- Item selection pairs with mission goals for intelligent replayability.
- Boss Fights and Survive X time objectives are exciting.
- Local Co-op

[b]CONS[/b]
- What the Fyck, doesn't sound right, maybe U's are ok.
- Some soundtrack selections were dismal.
- Not genre busting, then again not wallet busting.

35503345.review:
Jydge es un shooter futurista con una dinámica de acción constante y un interesante sistema de recompensas y upgrades. Personaliza tu propio policía robot en este juego que no da tregua.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LJrpnZcyBm4
Análisis completo publicado [url=https://www.simpatiaporlacritica.com/single-post/2017/10/05/Jydge]aquí[/url]

Claramente influenciado por películas y cómics como Robocop y Judge Dredd, este título desarrollado por el estudio independiente 10tons transcurre en un futuro cybernético donde la fuerza de seguridad más eficiente es un sistema de robots policías -y jueces- que deben enfrentarse a los peligros más extremos y llegar donde ningún humano podría. Controlamos a uno de estos robots y debemos patrullar la ciudad realizando misiones que serán cada vez más desafiantes a lo largo del juego.
 
El entorno gráfico es correcto, no es precisamente lo más destacado del juego, aunque se agradece en cuanto a fluidez. Con mecánicas que requieren mucha precisión y velocidad, un motor gráfico con más calidad en sus texturas representaría una carga para computadoras que no sean de alta gama. De todas formas, no es un impedimento para meternos de lleno en el mundo del juego ni le quita diversión. Lo mismo con el sonido y música, ambos aprobados.
 
Nos metemos de lleno en los aspectos más interesantes del juego, que son sus mecánicas y la personalización de los trajes y armas. Por ser un shooter top-down, el aspecto clave del juego es la mecánica de puntería y ataque con el mouse, lo cual está muy bien optimizado. Toda la interfaz es muy agradable de jugar con mouse y teclado, lo cual es algo raro últimamente, siendo que la industria de juegos de PC se está volcando al joystick. La respuesta de comando es intuitiva y veloz, lo cual hace al juego muy sencillo de controlar y particularmente adictivo.

Tanto la armadura como el arma de nuestro personaje es completamente customizable y el árbol de habilidades y mejoras de upgrades es realmente amplio e interesante. Desde distintos tipos de munición, hasta habilidades pasivas, las opciones para crear una build a gusto con nuestra manera de jugar son muy amplias. Incluso cada mejora tiene niveles para subir, lo cual hace todo aún más diverso. 
 
La dificultad es extraña, porque al principio da la impresión de ser un juego muy sencillo, quizás hasta demasiado fácil. Sin embargo, a medida que progresamos vamos a notar que lo desafiante de Jydge son las "medallas" que nos proponen en cada misión, que vendrían a ser tareas a cumplir además de la más obvia, como puede ser rescatar rehenes o matar a todos los enemigos. En teoría estas misiones secundarias son optativas, pero para poder avanzar en los capítulos de la historia descubriremos que necesitamos hacerlas para poder progresar. Esto quiere decir que nos veremos repitiendo muchas veces determinadas misiones hasta lograr una performance perfecta.
 
Jydge es un juego muy divertido, entretenido, fácil de jugar y sumamente desafiante a la vez. Es muy parecido a Ruiner, otro juego indie que adjuntamos en relacionados. Ambos son ampliamente recomendados y cuando los prueben les va a costar dejarlos de jugar.

35500993.review:
Наконеч-то я дождался игры JYDGE, от студии 10tons, подарившие нам легендарный Crimsonland, шикарнейший Neon Chrome и весьма хардкордную Time Recoil. JYDGE выполнена в духе кинолент "Робокоп" и "Судья Дредд". Сюжетно косвенно связанная с миром игры Neon Chrome. Сразу после анонса и трейлера я понял, что просто обязан в неё сыграть. И не ошибся! 
Здесь мы будем устанавливать "Закон и Порядок" (ЭКСТЕРМИНАТУС) на улицах громадного мегаполиса Эдембург руками могучего СУДЬИ - киборга-полицейского в силовой броне, вооруженного "терминаторской" пушкой МОЛОТ (похожей на легендарный Winchester 1887, только с кувалдой вместо штыка и широким выбором режимов огня: это и автомат, и дробовик, и гранатомет, и плазмапушка, и просто кувалда - ну вы поняли, штуковина серьезная). Самого Судью также можно модернизировать под те или иные тактические ситуации. Так что идите смело очищать кишашие преступниками улицы Эдембурга под забойный саундтрек. 
Вердикт: 10 приговоров из 10. И, конечно, творческих успехов одной из моих любимых студий:) 
P.S.2017 выдался по-настоящему "урожайным" на "мясные" Top-Down шутеры: тут вам и история искупления грехов бесстрашного монаха Василия из Redeemer, и личная война киборга-социопата в стиле "Один против всего мира" из Ruiner. Также весьма достойными получились такие проекты, как вышедший из раннего доступа хоррор-экшн Darkwood, не менее мрачный постапокалиптический Enlightment, киберпанк-бойня Westboro и, наконец, симулятор зачистки марсианской базы Solstice Chronicles: MIA. Теперь в эту "мясную" коллекцию пришел JYDGE.
P.P.S. Впрочем, год ещё не закончился, а за ним последует и новый 2018 - так что вы можете размазать в мясо тысячи зомби в свежевышедшей Versus Squad (если вас это не утомит), а также в Steam должны появиться такие проекты как Hell Hunter и God Trigger - графонистые симуляторы охоты на разномастных демонов. Ну а пока что, настало время СУДЬИ.

35497244.review:
Мне, как любителю убей-их-всех топ-даун шутеров, эта игра зашла на столько, что я тут же побежал писать положительный обзор. 

Игра выполнена на базе Neon Chrome, предыдущей игры создателей легендарного Crimsonland`а. Есть несколько актов по несколько миссий, с основными (типа "спаси заложников" или "убей босса" (не перепутай!)) и дополнительными (типа "не получи урон", "успей за 20 секунд" и т.д.) задачами. Входим на миссию, чего-нибудь там делаем, выходим и закупаемся оружием, которое (как и перки, дополнительное оружие, и свойства оружия) открывается по мере выполнения заданий (выполняете больше дополнительных заданий - открываете больше возможностей для прокачки, манчкинизм и задротство). 

Что еще сказать? Игровой процесс - бегать, стрелять и уворачиваться от пуль (ах да, если враг вообще не ожидал, что ему прилетит, то урон - повышенный), обвешиваться новым оружием, прокачиваться и выполнять задания, для открытия новых видов оружия и прокачки.

Для меня стало неожиданностью прохождение первого акта. Сразу же открылся режим "хардкор", а это те же миссии, но со злыми врагами, которых больше и которые радостно убивают заложников. Ну и плюсом это новые дополнительные миссии и соответственно, чтобы открыть все, придется проходить этот хардкор (ну это для любителей перфекта, я уверен, такие - есть).

Если описанное выше показалось вам лютым бредом, не могу вас винить. А если прочитав этот сумбур вам показалось, что игра - классная, то вам - не показалось))

35496812.review:
Hello here is my review for Jydge.


Jydge is a top down shooter with role playing? elements. You have a campaign with 4 acts. Each act has 4 missions. You choose the missions on a city map or in the drop down menu. Each mission has a normal and a hardcore mode to unlock. You progress through earning medals in missions. The goals for earning medals are like "do not take any damage" or "do the mission in 20 seconds" "open all containers".  The more medals the more missions, weapon mods and cyberware you unlock. Then you have to buy the upgrades with credits earned in missions.

Cyberware are upgrades for your character. There are 28 cyberware upgrades in the game. More health, stealth in shadows, 20% more speed, a riot shield, take less damage etc. Your character can have 4 cyberware upgrades at a time.

There is only one weapon in the game, the gavel, but you can upgrade this universal weapon carrier with different mods and firing modes. You have a main attack and a special weapon attack. Special weapons are things like rockets, spider bots, stun grenades. You can have 3 firing modes in your weapon.

There are 15 special weapons in the game.

There are 25 firing modes in the game.

The gameplay is fast and furious. You can play gun blazing or more tactically. Killing lone enemies sneakily. For some medals you need a clever plan to succed.

The hardcore mode is a little harder but not unfair. The missions get seriously hard to the end.

If you like top down run n gun shooter like Smash TV, or Neon Chrome, or Crimsonland you will like this game. For crimsonlands veterans it is perhaps a little easy. 

The game is only 400 mb big and runs very good even on older machines. The game visuals are simplistic but you are here for the gameplay. The enviroment is completely destructible, except thick walls.

Thank you for reading, i hope my review was informative.

Have a nice day.

35483725.review:
I've played a LOT of Neon Chrome and I love JYDGE. It's set in the same universe, and call it a standalone expansion if you will but it plays and flows very differently and the changes are all good. If you have played Neon Chrome you will get the basic skeleton of what is going on, but the way you tackle the game and the way you progress is totally different.

It does have replayability in the sense there are medals for each mission and because it's not procedurally generated you can improve on your attempt each time or just plan to focus on one of the harder medals and get the rest later. Medals are awarded for things like "save all hostages" or "get in and out in 20 seconds". Medals are used to unlock implants for the JYDGE and upgrades for the Gavel(his gun) and the more you unlock the more creative you can get with your loadout. After I beat ACT 1 it unlocked a hardcore mode that I could replay the missions with for more medals and more upgrades. So that's what I did, beat the first act and then started on it again and quite happily.

You could really specialise for a particular medal if you liked. Because there are no random elements, and along with your character, the gun has multiple perk slots and the volume and variety of perks, I can see great things ahead.

The music is excellent, more dynamic and aggressive, which really helps when you are able to walk through most of the props you had to shoot or melee in Neon Chrome. Windows? Just walk through them. Thinner walls? just walk through them.

I'm entirely delighted with JYDGE. If you liked Neon Chrome this is different enough to stand on it's own.

Two enthusiastic thumbs up.

35482757.review:
Erste schnelle Eindrücke,

Unkompliziertes Gameplay, man kommt leicht rein und man will gar nicht mehr aufhören. Jedoch sind die Missionen fordernd, was eher positiv zu sehen ist. 
Es erinnert schon ein wenig an Hotline Miami, bietet aber mehr Konfigurationsmöglichkeiten  und wesentlich mehr Lösungswege um Missionen abzuschliessen. Auch gibt es Missionen die eher an klassiche Top-Down-Shooter erinnern, wie (von der selben Firma) Neon Chrome, oder Crimsonland, wo es also ums nackte Überleben geht.
Ansonsten geht es in den Missionen um Geisselbefreiung, Gangster terminieren, Bomben entschärfen. Und dabei noch fleissig Geld konfiszieren.  Je nachdem wie man die Mission geschafft hat erhält man Medallien dafür die, je mehr man davon hat, neue Waffenmodis und Cypertechs freischalten die man an seinem Jydge dann einbauen kann (nachdem man sie noch zusätzlich gekauft hat) .

Grafik find ich nicht ganz so gelungen, Sound und Musik sind okay, Steuerung, hab zwar Controller bisher nicht getestet, aber mit Maus/Keyboard ist es flüssig und recht unkompliziert.

Vom Umfang her, was ich bisher gesehen habe, gibt es mindestens 6 Level. Können aber auch mehr sein) die in 5-6 Missionen unterteilt sind. Erstes Level hab ich in einer Stunde geschafft. Und ab Level 2 wird es echt schwer. Ich schätze also es kann gut und gerne ca. 20 Stunden unterhalten, bis alle Level geschafft sind.

Dazu kommt, jede MIssionen hat auch einen "knallhart" Modus der nach und nach freigeschaltet wird. 

Schade finde ich aber vor allem, die Missionen selbst sind nicht zufällig generiert, also immer die selben. Schränkt also Wiederspielwert ein. Was ich immer generell Schade finde.

Ich würde es als deutlich gutes Gelegenheitsspiel bezeichnen, das einem erstmal nur schwer loslässt, aber eher nur mässigen Wiederspielwert bietet.

35482751.review:

35481154.review:
The best way I've found to describe JYDGE is "top-down reverse Payday".

You play as a JYDGE, one of many robotic(?) Lawbringers protecting the city of Edenbyrg from crime. Your JYDGE is extremely customizable through the use of various Cyberenhancements. Lights Out and Shadow Blend turns you into an invisible force, killing everything in your way. Pick up Giant and Extra Armor, and you become extremely difficult to kill, and can tank pretty much anything. Cyberenhancements aren't the only custom option, there are also Special Weapons like Rockets, Turrets or my personal favorite, the Pyschoactive Darts that cause enemies to explode violently after killing every ally in sight.

Then, there are several different basic weapons. Shotguns, Ion Balls, Lazyrs, Snypers and even a Mingyn, all through the Gavel MK 1, probably the most badass gun ever. And that hammer on the end isn't just for show. Certain weapon mods (which also affect your fire) can improve this Gavel, making it explode on impact, or turning you into a bullet deflecting Jedi.

So JYDGE is extremely customizable, but do the levels allow for it? Of course. The levels are almost perfectly designed so that sneaking, guns blazing, and any other playstyle are accounted for. Each level also has 3 medals that you get for completing tasks in each one, that encourage a variety of weapons and enhancements. Furthermore, each level has 4 difficulties to it, that change the layout of enemies and the medals for each one.

Is the game perfect? No, not really. The story is really bareboned, though I must mention that there are various endings depending on how you play. But I'd like to see that quality amplified. Oftentimes the enemies don't seem that interesting. They look like Runescape Characters, with their hair color denoting their strength. The bosses especially are just like the regular enemies. I wish there was more variance here. But, with 18 levels, 3 medals, 4 difficulties, and a ton of weapons and modifications, JYDGE is definitely worth playing.

Seriously though, the melee deflect is so fricking cool! When do I get a mod that changes the Gavel into a lightsaber?

This is the Dredd game I was always hoping for.

It's a lovely top down shooter, but the real joy comes from all the unlocks you'll be getting. Shotguns with chain lighting, goons as backup firepower, turrets, wall smashing abilities, etc. These are all great, but they really start to gel when you begin playing with builds in order to beat some of the challenges. 

For example: One challenge was to kill just the boss and escape in under 20 seconds. Trying to get through winding hallways with various goons shooting at you would be a pain in the neck. Or you can throw on Super Hero (Immortal for the first 15 seconds of a mission) And Wall Breaker (Run straight through walls), a heavy shotgun, and yell "HEY KOOL AID" while you burst through everything in your way, blast the boss, and run on back to your car while everything bounces off your armor.

Need a stealthy approach? Sniper rifles go great with cloaking devices, and if they never hear their friends get plinked, no worries! Need to make sure all the civilians are safe? Good news, there's a Civilian safe ammo mod. Don't bring a Gatling gun without it!

Seriously though: The game's a blast, and will last you a good while with various mission difficulties and challenges, as well as a few cross mission secrets to uncover.

35476479.review:
[b]Alright, so another title from 10Tons that is uncomfortably close to [i]Neon Chrome[/i].[/b] This one is quite good. Now to be clear it is not as good as [i]Neon Chrome[/i], but that's ok. [i]Neon Chrome[/i] has nearly infinite replayability due to proc gen, and [i]JYDGE[/i] has premade levels (I will not use the term 'hand crafted'). The rogueish factor in [i]Neon Chrome[/i] also gave it serious hooks for addicting gameplay.

But yeah, [i]JYDGE[/i] is solid and does its own thing pretty well. 

I like the mission structure and the tons of really cool unlockables and gear. 10Tons has shown they are really good at coming up with cool and novel mechanics, and now they have also shown us that they understand how to hide grind. That's a fantastic skill to have when developing games. 

But on a very serious note - and moving forward - please, no more [i]Neon Chrome[/i] look-alikes. I [i]know[/i] that [i]Time Recoil[/i] had its own angle and so does [i]JYDGE[/i], but the whole 'feel' begins to wear thin at some point. 

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Great functional unlockables and gear to customize your dude
+There is some pretty great subtle humor
+I like the mission structure
+The price point is right

[b]Cons:[/b]
-I think this would have done better with proc gen levels; the premade levels aren't anything super special (have the levels generate once per save, so mission 1 is always the same BUT was randomly generated that once)
-I want those feels back from last summer when I was super addicted to [i]Neon Chrome[/i], and both [i]JYDGE[/i] and [i]Time Recoil[/i] sort of tease with that but don't deliver on that level (and that's ok, but it's true)

[b]Get [i]Neon Chrome[/i] first, but then get [i]JYDGE[/i].[/b]

JYDGE is a top-down twinstick based in the Neon Chrome universe. If you liked that aesthetic and like the concept of Judge Dredd, then you'll love the feel of this game. The game makes you a JYDGE; what makes them so fun is the way they handle the law and their customization. You can try to be stealthy or just run in guns blazing. Your JYDGE has lots of loadout potential; there's loadouts for the JYDGE themselves, mods for the gun itself, and lots of different ammo types and special weapons to choose from.

Levels aren't Roguelike though, they are hand crafted. Same goes for the buffs/mods, you get them in a specific order instead of random drop.

I had a lot of fun running around and shooting enemies while avoiding getting shot. This game does Twinstick very well and I enjoyed it a lot.

35470965.review:
JYDGE is in my opinion the best and most enjoyable shooter from 10Tons so far. 

In JYDGE you complete missions, each of them having one main and two optional objectives, ranging from rescuing hostages, killing heads of various gangs, defusing bombs, gathering evidence, but also more tricky ones like completing level under some time, not getting hit, using only melee attacks, not killing anyone or not getting spotted while doing all of this. Completing those objectives earns you medals, which unlock various things to buy - firemodes for weapon of Jydge, Gavel, both standard and special, and cyberware - mods (perks), separated into Gavel mods related to weapons and more general ones. 

Those perks are very varied, definitely the most in 10Tons shooters so far. There are many standard buffs to firerate, reload speed, movement speed, but also immunity to explosions, perks that give various companion drones, hacking tool with different usages, additional shield, various types of camouflage, weapon buffs like ability to stun or knock back enemies, perks that make you smaller or really huge, and later even perk which gives you total invulnerability for few first seconds of a level - and all those are just a few of them, there are many more. 

Weapons are also varied and are more versatile than those in Neon Chrome for example. Ion projectiles will electrocute nearby enemies, laser projectiles will bounce off walls. There is also nice selection of special weapons, not only grenades and rockets, but there are now also deployable turrets or decoy drones. Melee is also a valid strategy, as there is plenty of perks that make melee attacks stronger or modify them in various ways, like causing melee attacks to be explosive or giving them chance to convert enemies to your side when they are hit.

Such perk and weapon diversity, together with map design - there always are different ways and routes into buildings and to targets - allows many different playstyles possible, from sneaking around taking out enemies from apart one by one with sniper firemode, through making frontal assault and razing entire level with minigun and rockets, to speedrunning levels and completing them just in ten seconds. Many of perks are strong individually, and can be completely broken with right combinations, which is sometimes even needed to complete objectives on highest difficulty levels. So if you enjoy finding strong combinations and ways to broke and exploit the game, JYDGE is really good choice for this.  

Medals/objectives also encourage changing strategies and approach. All levels have four difficulties available, and maps change a little on each of them, mostly with types of enemies, their placement and numbers, but not only that. There is also quite plenty of secret collectibles and special levels entrances hidden on them.

Overall this is really good top down shooter, quite unique with its mission system. My only concern is that it always could be longer with more missions, but still if you decide to complete all medals on all difficulties it should take at least around fifteen hours.

35470934.review:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1157581718

JYDGE é um twin-stick shooter tático que se passa no mesmo universo distópico do roguelite Neon Chrome. Apesar de ter gráficos e controles bem similares, a jogabilidade no fim das contas é bem diferente pelo estilo do jogo ter outra pegada.

Em JYDGE, você tem a ação dividida em fases, cada fase tendo um objetivo principal para ser concluída. Você chegará em seu veículo, terá de cumprir a missão, e sair ao veículo para concluir a fase.

O detalhe é que todas as fases possuem medalhas a serem conseguidas, que são objetivos secundários, como completar a fase em X tempo, ou fazer alguma ação específica, como lootear todos os itens, matar todos os inimigos, ou resgatar todos os civis.

Seu grande diferencial é justamente esse sistema, que aumenta muito a rejogabilidade de cada fase, e faz com que você tenha de revisitar uma fase mais de uma vez usando uma estratégia diferente para aumentar sua chance de sucesso.

Sobre estratégia, o jogo tem um grande patamar de combinações. Você poderá instalar modificações no JUYZ, mudar as funções primárias e secundárias de sua arma, além de também instalar modificações nela. As combinações possíveis vão aumentando conforme você joga, à medida que consegue mais medalhas, e constituem a progressão permanente do jogo.

A jogabilidade é bem clássica do gênero, movendo o personagem com WASD, atirando com botão esquerdo do mouse (tiro primário, munição infinita) e botão direito (tiro secundário, munição limitada), podendo recarregar com R e bater corpo-a-corpo com barra de espaços. Caso jogue no controle, poderá utilizar um sistema de auxílio de mira, que pode ser desativado.

Além de sua grande complexidade de builds e jogabilidade simples e intuitiva, JYDGE conta com suporte à cooperativo local para 2 jogadores, com um segundo jogador podendo entrar durante as fases apertando Y no joystick. A câmera se afasta levemente quando os jogadores ficam distantes, e não há fogo-amigo, exceto para armas explosivas. Caso um jogador morra, a partida continuará normalmente para o outro, mas como as fases são rápidas, isso não constitui problema algum.

Imperdível pra quem já é fã de carteirinha dos twin-stick shooters da 10tons, como fãs em geral do gênero!

35470885.review:
Я – закон! Именно так себя позиционирует главный герой игры Jydge, о который мы сейчас и поговорим. 

В далеком 1995 году, на экраны вышел легендарный фильм «Судья Дредд», который просто снес крышу зрителям. Сильвестр Сталлоне, лихой сюжет, отличные перестрелки и великолепно прорисованный и проработанный окружающий мир, все это в купе, не оставило равнодушным никого, кто видел этот кинчик в суровых 90х. Разработчики из студии 10tons Ltd., видимо и по сей день под впечатлением от этой картины, ведь они в своей игре сделали все, что бы мы вспомнили того самого сурового, справедливого и беспощадного судью Дредда. 

Игра представляет из себя top-down шутер, в котором мы примем на себя обязанности Судьи. Наша задача, это зачищать локации от бандитского мусора, который таким и сыпет из каждой двери и проулка, спасать заложников, уничтожать главарей банд и их пешек, и много другое. Далее по порядку.

Геймплей. Играется игра великолепно, без преувеличения. Управление крайне отзывчивое и удобное, каждая ваша оплошность или удачное действие, зависит только от вас. В игре главное внимательность и скорость реакции, ведь врагов много, они опасны, а вы один и никто вам не поможет. Врывайтесь в комнаты, моментально убивайте врагов и следите за их подкреплением, которое порой может привалить из крайне неожиданных мест. Стрельба ощущается просто на ура. Превращать врагов в кровавые мишени – невероятное удовольствие. По мере прохождения игры, вы будете получать деньги, за которые сможете купить усовершенствования для своего Судьи, а так же прокачать свое оружие, которое здесь одно, но его функционал просто зашкаливает. По мере прокачки персонажа, будут открывать новые возможности у вашей пушки (кстати, называется она здесь, крайне канонично «Приговор») и она сможет стать как автоматом-дробовиком, так и огнеметом, ракетницой, базукой и еще много чем. Каждый найдет стрельку себе по вкусу. В игре большой город, на карте которого вы найдете кучу заданий, которые будете поочередно выполнять, возвращаясь на прошлые миссии, что бы выполнить на них все челенджи.

Графика и музыка. Графически игра выполнена на высшем уровне. Художникам и дизайнерам можно аплодировать стоя. Каждая локация хоть и похожа чутка на предыдущую, но имеет не мало своих уникальных отличий и ощущается совершенно по новому. Музыка аналогично сделана на высшем уровне и отлично дополняет стиль игры и сам игровой процесс. 

В игре так же есть кооператив, в котором вы с другими игроками сможете наводить порядок в городе. Не скажу что в копе веселее играть, но его наличие это большой плюс в копилку игры.

В завершении хочу сказать, что это крайне уникальный и самобытный проект, который однозначно станет хитом (хотя бы в узких кругах) и надеюсь хорошо продастся, ведь разработчики буквально вложили душу в игру. Отличный шутер с прокачкой и челенджами, которые однозначно увлекут вас на долгие часы.

9 застреленных наркоманов из 10!  Я – закон!
